description: A deconstructed statistical weighting system, mapping precise evidence combinations from the allegation catalog to outcome probabilities. This model acknowledges the inherent absurdity of predicting legal outcomes by quantifying the narrative power of evidence collections.

002.description: The 'slam dunk': an unambiguous written contract, documented breach, and quantifiable damages.

evidence_requirements.subtype: The contract itself
Correspondence about the breach
Invoices and payment records
Graphs illustrating financial losses

002.description: He-said-she-said elevated by a third party and digital whispers.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Testimony from parties involved
Third-party witness testimony
Emails or text messages discussing the contract terms or breach

002.description: A battle of well-paid experts interpreting contractual tea leaves.

evidence_requirements.subtype: The contract itself
Expert testimony on industry standards

013.description: A clear, demonstrable error supported by a chorus of agreeing experts.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Expert medical testimony for the plaintiff
Medical records showing the procedure and outcome
Medical illustrations or models showing the injury

013.description: The 'two schools of thought' defense, where professional disagreement muddies the waters.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Expert medical testimony for the plaintiff
Expert medical testimony for the defendant
Medical literature supporting both sides

013.description: A recognized breach of care, but a weak link to the plaintiff's ultimate injury.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Expert medical testimony for the plaintiff
Medical records showing the procedure and outcome
Plaintiff's pre-existing medical records

015.description: Negligence captured on camera; a narrative that writes itself.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Video footage of the incident
Eyewitness testimony
Medical bills and records of injury
Accident reports

015.description: A case built from the wreckage by an accident reconstructionist.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Plaintiff's testimony
Medical bills and records of injury
Accident reconstruction expert testimony
Photos of the accident scene and property damage

031.description: The defendant, the accelerant, and the fire, all tied together.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Presence of accelerants at the scene
Eyewitness testimony placing defendant at the scene
Security camera footage
Defendant's fingerprints or DNA on accelerant container

031.description: Circumstantial case built on financial distress and a timely insurance policy.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Expert testimony from fire investigators ruling out accidental cause
Financial records showing defendant's debt
Insurance policy on the property
Testimony regarding defendant's recent financial statements

077.description: The trifecta: physical evidence, eyewitnesses, and a confession.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Weapon with defendant's fingerprints or DNA
Multiple eyewitnesses to the act
Defendant's confession to law enforcement
Autopsy report confirming cause of death

077.description: A narrative of motive, means, and opportunity woven from digital footprints and testimony.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Threatening emails or texts from defendant
Cell phone location data placing defendant at the scene
Testimony establishing strong motive (e.g., financial gain, jealousy)
Ballistics report matching defendant's gun

077.description: A case precariously balanced on the testimony of a compromised informant.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Testimony from a cooperating witness in exchange for a deal
Autopsy report confirming cause of death

096.description: A clear, documented path from information to trade.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Emails, text messages, or voicemails conveying inside information
Brokerage records showing trades made shortly after receiving information
Testimony from the source of the inside information

096.description: A case built on inference, where suspicious patterns must tell the story.

evidence_requirements.subtype: Brokerage records showing unusually timed or sized trades
Expert testimony on statistical improbability of the trades
Computer logs showing access to confidential files

modifiers.description: Evidence obtained via illegal search and seizure (Fruit of the Poisonous Tree).
modifiers.notes: Renders a specific piece of evidence worthless and can collapse a case if that evidence was foundational.

modifiers.description: Defendant's voluntary, Mirandized, and recorded confession.
modifiers.notes: A powerful modifier, though its impact is lessened by credible claims of coercion or mental incompetence.

modifiers.description: Key prosecution witness has prior perjury conviction.
modifiers.notes: A gift to the defense. The 'falsus in uno, falsus in omnibus' argument becomes devastatingly effective.

modifiers.description: Overwhelming, unrelated 'bad character' evidence admitted against defendant.
modifiers.notes: Despite instructions to the contrary, juries often struggle to separate prior bad acts from the question of guilt in the current case.
The adverse inference instruction tells the jury to assume the worst about what was destroyed.
Paints the plaintiff as someone who uses the courts as a weapon, undermining their credibility.

modifiers.description: Key witness for opposing party impeached with prior inconsistent statement.
modifiers.notes: A classic 'gotcha' moment that can destroy a witness's credibility and the narrative they support.

modifiers.description: Binding, on-point, negative precedent from a higher court in the jurisdiction.
modifiers.notes: The legal argument is effectively dead on arrival unless a compelling distinction can be made.
